channel.title: New question
channel.description: When I add a npc over another npc EXAMPLE [code] npc = 431 Guard 113 150 60 [/code] To [code] npc = 431 Kree'arra 113 150 60 [/code] I change the code server side, and client side, but when I do ::npc 431 I get the guard, not kree'arra Any ideas?

item.title: New question
item.dc:creator: @Shorty626 Shorty626
item.description:
@Shorty626 wrote:

Well maybe someone needs to learn English and make his question more clear. Lol 12 year olds that think they know what programming is because they can write a piece of code in Java.

Read full topic

item.title: New question
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote="Dj_Bigdadd, post:1, topic:342412"][quote author=Shorty626 link=topic=438747.msg3224797#msg3224797 date=1275485575]

Its because the guard is before the other NPC. That isn’t going to work. If I give 2 workers ID numbers that are the same and I don’t know their names or what they look like then how am I to know which one is who? The server is only displaying what it reads in from the config file.

wrong wrong wrong read what he said dipshit you have’t been helping ppl

and you obviously messed up models some how if you dont add models right it wont should up. double check your ints also this is a client sided issue

Before you tell me I’m wrong, please learn something. Thanks.
[/quote]

actually haveing the same id before each on the same x and y just means theres going to be 2 there which wont mess anything up and you read what your saying wasnt even what he was asking he needs to set his models correctly or it wont work and his ints which is client dont tell me to learn something when you don’t even know what hes asking[/quote]mr retard the client wont know what he wants to spawn there; and will go for the default in the cache.

Read full topic
